content:
Hi Team

Alana submitted the our generated FHIR file (QA) to NCHS and got the error message as response saying "Jurisdiction ID was not identified".
We would like to know the issue to be investigate.

image.png

Got response from NCHS as below :
The problem here is not related to using “YC” as jurisdictionID, the issue is using the right FHIR resource profile for the death occurrence State in your Message bundle.

Please reach out to MITRE to verify the FHIR resource to use for Death Location.

Thanks
Velan for NYC DOHHMH
hi @Velan Please attach your example file to this topic and we'll take a look.

Saul Kravitz said:

hi Velan Please attach your example file to this topic and we'll take a look.

Attached again the file for your review....if you didn't receive again please let me know your mail id.

YC_DEATH_2107261025_19018672_New.json

Hi @Velan

Several comments:
In address fields, the state should use the standard 2 letter postal encoding. So, New York is NY, not YC.
State is state, and jurisdiction is jurisdiction. Only in the case of jurisdiction is YC applicable. They key missing aspect of your example is the lack of a juridictionId extension in the Death Location resource.

Your example:

{
              "resourceType": "Location",
              "id": "eba61afc-91eb-40ed-97b4-ebd585e4d794",
              "meta": {
                "profile": [
                  "http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr/StructureDefinition/VRDR-Death-Location"
                ]
              },
              "name": "Testing Hospital (Manhattan)",
              "type": [
                {
                  "coding": [
                    {
                      "code": "16983000"
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ],
              "address": {
                "line": [
                  "125 Worth St"
                ],
                "city": "New York",
                "district": "New York",
                "state": "YC",
                "postalCode": "10013-4006",
                "country": "United States"
              }
            }

Your example amended with state encoding and jurisdiction extension.
Note that in the STU2 version of the VRDR IG, the extension url is changing from jurisdictionId to http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr/StructureDefinition/Location-Jurisdiction-Id 

{
              "resourceType": "Location",
              "id": "eba61afc-91eb-40ed-97b4-ebd585e4d794",
              "meta": {
                "profile": [
                  "http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr/StructureDefinition/VRDR-Death-Location"
                ]
              },
             "extension": [
                 {
                   "url": "jurisdictionID",
                  "valueCodeableConcept": {
                  "coding": [ {
                  "system": "urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.92",
                  "code": "YC",
                  "display": "New York City"
                  }
                ]
                }
             }
           ],
              "name": "Testing Hospital (Manhattan)",
              "type": [
                {
                  "coding": [
                    {
                      "code": "16983000",
                      "system":  "urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.96"  ,
                     "display":   "Death in Hospital"
                    }
                  ]
                }
              ],
              "address": {
                "line": [
                  "125 Worth St"
                ],
                "city": "New York",
                "district": "New York",
                "state": "NY",
                "postalCode": "10013-4006",
                "country": "United States"
              }
            }

Saul Kravitz said:

Hi Velan

Several comments:
In address fields, the state should use the standard 2 letter postal encoding. So, New York is NY, not YC.
State is state, and jurisdiction is jurisdiction. Only in the case of jurisdiction is YC applicable. They key missing aspect of your example is the lack of a juridictionId extension in the Death Location resource.

Your example:

Your example amended with state encoding and jurisdiction extension.
Note that in the STU2 version of the VRDR IG, the extension url is changing from jurisdictionId to http://hl7.org/fhir/us/vrdr/StructureDefinition/Location-Jurisdiction-Id 

{
              "resourceType": "Location",
              "id": "eba61afc-91eb-40ed-97b4-ebd585e4d794",
              "meta": {

              },
             "extension": [
                 {
                   "url": "jurisdictionID",
                  "valueCodeableConcept": {
                  "coding": [ {
                  "system": "urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.92",
                  "code": "YC",
                  "display": "New York City"
                  }
                ]
                }
             }
           ],
              "name": "Testing Hospital (Manhattan)",
              "type": [
                {
                  "coding": [
                    {
                      "code": "16983000",
                      "system":  "urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.96"  ,
                     "display":   "Death in Hospital"
                    }

              ],
              "address": {
                "line": [
                  "125 Worth St"
                ],

                "postalCode": "10013-4006",
                "country": "United States"
              }
            }
````
Agreed, Thanks for your immediate response.  I found "DeathLocationJurisdiction" property member to assign for Death location, whereas for Birth place do have any?  Since making in address state.

Thanks
Velan

`````



Agreed, Thanks for your immediate response.  I found "DeathLocationJurisdiction" property member to assign for Death location, whereas for Birth place do have any?  Since making in address state.

Thanks
Velan

Agreed, Thanks for your immediate response. I found "DeathLocationJurisdiction" property member to assign for Death location,
whereas for Birth place do have any? Since making in address state.

Hi @Velan ,
Good question. The jurisdiction isn't required in the Birth-Record-Identifier, which I too find puzzling. (see https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-33146). The code there is a country/state in iso:3166:-2 format.

@AbdulMalik Shakir @Cindy Bush
Thanks a lot - Velan

Hi @Saul Kravitz @Pete Krautscheid @Sarah MacAdam

I check no update available on the VRDR component. Any update on "DeathLocationJurisdiction" issue?

Thanks
Velan

Hi @Velan -- are you asking about the DeathLocation.extension.jurisdictionID? Although the comments on updates indicate that is now mandatory (1..1), the IG has clearly not yet been updated. Apologies for the confusion. Treat that extension as mandatory. The new version of the VRDR .NET library will treat your input as invalid without it.

Obvious next question: when will the library be available? Shooting for Wednesday of next week.

Regards,
Saul

Hi @Saul Kravitz @Sarah MacAdam @Pete Krautscheid

We have changed the "Death Location Jurisdiction" to show as below....wants to check with your it's valid? Appreciate your response ASAP. Have attached the file below to valid from your side.

image.png

Sample File attached to validation:
YC_DEATH_2108231636_19018587_Update.json

Thanks
Velan
NYC Dept eVital Team

Hi @Velan,

              "coding": [ {
                "system": "urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.245",
                "code": "975772",
                "display": "YC"
              }]

If you need other codes, they are as per https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewValueSet.action?id=282D4DD8-39EA-4C5B-B8A9-B2C3E5878A15
All of the jurisdictions EXCEPT NYC are from CodeSystem "urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.92". YC is from "urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.245".

Not intuitive.
I have not checked the full file.

Thanks a lot, would you mind validating whole file? we have a production go process.

I appreciate your help
Velan

Hi @Saul Kravitz

Is this code applicable for Death Location Jurisdiction only or birth place state codes as well?

For Birth Place State we are using https://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet-v2-notAllCodes-0347.html

Please let us know.
Velan

Hi @Velan,
The Jurisdiction Value Set is used only in the jurisdictionID extension to DeathLocation.
For BirthRecordIdentifier.component:state the representation is ISO 3266-2 (e.g., US-NY), using states, not jurisdictions (NY, not YC).
All other state fields should use the USPS 2-letter codes (as per USCore).

I'll try to look at your record tomorrow. The new version of the VRDR library and tools (not yet Canary) has been released (V3.2.0-preview1 nuget github) so you could try to roundtrip conversion to IJE on a do-it-yourself basis.

Regards, Saul

Hi @Saul Kravitz

We have generated the file yesterday, still output file shows "Jurisdiction_id" as "NY" from VRDR.

image.png

Got error response while submitting to NCHS.
NY21000_ERR_000046.JSON.1629891591761 NY21000_ERR_000121.JSON.1629893092184

When I looking into "VRDR.DeathRecord" component, Jurisdiction ID derived from the address state of Death Location (which is postal address "NY" - which was you suggested sometime back in another thread). I am confused, please advice me.

image.png

I did see (VRDR 3.2 preview) VRDRMessage.BaseMessage.cs "Jurisdiction_ID" still looking in death location address state only. Didn't see the fix yet.

image.png

Thanks
Velan

Thanks @Velan for catching that bug. I'm working on getting the fix incorporated and released.
The fix (I think) is to replace DeathLocationAddress?["addressState"] with DeathLocationJurisdiction.

Hi @Velan,
I reviewed the DeathRecord bundle within the file you sent me, and it looks good. I corrected only:

- BundleIdentifier should include YC (you know this already)
- the system for the ISO3166-2 value should (according to the IG) be the PHINVADs OID, not the HL7 URL (hopefully this will change before STU2 publication)
- the system and display value were missing for DeathLocation.type.

My test was to use the VRDR.CLI tool to roundtrip the input (roundtrip-all). So, certainly not testing any business rules that Veronique may test.

NYCtest.son

Regards,
Saul

Hi @Saul Kravitz

Thanks for verifying.... (NEW VRDR 3.2 Preview) doesn't fix DeathLocationJurisidiction (still not changed to CodeableConcept)
Now changed the Death Location Jurisdiction to show as below (in FHIR file)....

image.png

Jurisdiction ID shows in message part as...

image.png

above is part for New York City department only (Not fixed in VRDR 3.2 Preview version)

Thanks
Velan
Hi @Velan Agreed. The message content not fixed. (It is on a branch, but not released yet...).

@Velan,
V3.2.0-preview2 is out....fixes the issue you identified. THX

Hi @Saul Kravitz

V3.2.0-preview2
Still the DeathLocationJurisdiction not changed to coded values concept, still it been "string". which wouldn't give output as below.
image.png

Thanks
Velan
@Velan I don't understand your comment. Can you please attach the full JSON file?

Hi @Saul Kravitz

Is VRDR "V3.2.0-Preview2" going to be final version before Connectathon? Please let me know to use in our project.

Thanks
Velan

Hi @Velan . We will have at least one more bug-fix pre-release (preview) before the connectathon. I expect the next release to be concurrent with the release of the updated Canary. I understand that in previous connectathons issues were discussed/resolved at the connectathons that resulted in additional releases. Your early use of the libraries has certainly helped us prepare for the connectathon. Thanks and have a good weekend, Saul
Velan has marked this topic as resolved.
